Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Erica Marshall, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/30/25, there was a disagreement between a staff member a
youth and the youth threatened to punch the staff member. The
staff member grabbed the youth by the hair/bonnet and the youth
did punch the staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on
4/10/2025. Youth A reported she was watching 90-day fiancé
when Staff 1 asked for her to change the channel due to the
inappropriate content. Youth A reported Staff 1 informed her of the
rules and regulations regarding shows youth can and cannot
watch. Youth A reported she changed the station to Deadly
Women. Youth A reported Staff 1 continued to try to redirect her.
Youth A reported Staff 1 left out of the room and upon coming
back, Staff 1 saw Youth A was still watching inappropriate shows,
so attempted to redirect Youth A again. Youth A reported Staff 1
sat adjacent from Youth A and stared at her until Youth A asked
Staff 1 what she was looking at. Staff 1 responded back saying
she could look wherever she wanted. Youth A admitted to telling
Staff 1 she would punch her. Youth A reported Staff 1 said I wish
you would. Youth A reported she stood up and Staff 1 stood up
next. Youth A reported she walked towards Staff 1 and punched
Staff 1 with a closed fist. Youth A admitted to punching staff until
Staff 1 was relieved. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed her bonnet
and hair during the altercation.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on
4/10/2025. Youth B was asleep on the couch but in the same
common area when the incident occurred. Youth B reported she
could hear Staff 1 asking Youth A to change the station on the
television. Youth B could hear the incident was escalating and
awaken to see Youth A in a fight stance with Staff 1. Youth B
reported Youth A began to punch Staff 1. Youth B did not see
Staff 1 hit or pull Youth A’s bonnet off her head. Youth B saw
Staff 1 blocking the closed fist punches that Youth A was
throwing. Youth B reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A hands to get
2

Youth A to stop. Youth B reported feeling safe in the facility and
reported she has never seen Staff 1 get physically aggressive with
other youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Vista Maria on 4/10/2025. Staff 1
reported being present in the common area during the afternoon
shift when she observed Youth A watching an inappropriate
television show. Staff 1 instructed Youth A to change the channel,
stating the content was not suitable for viewing in the facility. She
then exited the common area to send out notices to staff regarding
appropriate programming for youth. Upon returning, Staff 1
observed Youth A continued to watch inappropriate content. Staff
1 issued a verbal warning in an effort to redirect Youth A. While
seated across from her, Youth A questioned why Staff 1 was
looking at her and then threatened to physically assault her. Youth
A stood up, approached Staff 1, and began punching her in the
head. Staff 1 reported attempting to defend herself by blocking the
punches and stated she raised her hands up to block Youth A’s
punches in self-defense. She denied any physical contact
involving Youth A’s bonnet or hair. Staff 1 sustained a small cut to
her head during the altercation. She was able to signal for
assistance, and Staff 2 arrived promptly to intervene.
Therapist was interviewed at Vista Maria on 4/10/2025. Therapist
reported Youth A disclosed the incident to her. Youth A was open
about her threat to hit Staff 1. Youth A also admitted to hitting Staff
1. According to Therapist, Youth A was not observed with marks
or bruises at the time of this disclosure. Therapist reported Youth
A has a history of aggressive behaviors but do not have any
concerns for her immediate safety.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 4/11/2025. Staff 2
witnessed the altercation firsthand. Staff 2 reported she saw Youth
A watching a show on the television. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 told
Youth A she could not watch certain shows. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 exited the office and upon return, redirected Youth A again
about inappropriate tv shows. Staff 2 reported hearing Youth A
say “I will slap the F out of you”. Staff 2 then saw Youth A strike
Staff 1 in the head. Staff 1 glasses were observed on the floor.
Staff 2 witnessed Staff 1 put her hands up to block the punches
coming from Youth A. Staff 2 reported she did not witness Staff 1
pull Youth A’s hair or bonnet. Staff 2 reported she did not hear any
profane language from Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 intervened
to assist with the fight.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 4/11/2025. Staff 3 was
on P wing and reported she heard a clear, so she came over to
Faith wing to see Youth A hitting Staff 1. Staff 3 reported getting
3

between Youth A and Staff 1 by using verbal de-escalation. Staff 3
reported seeing Staff 1 eyeglasses on the ground. According to
Staff 3, Staff 2 was able to separate Youth A and Staff 1, but
Youth A continued to lunge towards Staff 1. Staff 2 asked Staff 1
to step off the unit, so Staff 1 left the area. Staff 3 denied hearing
Staff 1 threaten Youth A.
Adoption Worker was interviewed via telephone on 4/14/2025.
Adoption Worker reported she spoke with Youth A, who reported
Youth A admitted to the incident. Youth A disclosed she was
asked to turn the television channel but refused and then
eventually changed the channel. Adoption worker reported Youth
A stated Staff 1 was staring at her, in which Youth A responded by
asking what Staff 1 was looking at. Youth A admitted to saying to
Staff 1 that she was going to punch Staff 1. Adoption Worker
reported Youth A was upset about the incident and admitted to
punching Staff 1 with a closed fist. Youth A further disclosed Staff
1 pulled her hair/bonnet during the altercation. Adoption worker
reported Youth A has a history of being physically and verbally
abusive with staff and peers.
Foster Care Specialist was interviewed via telephone on 4/23/25.
Foster Care Specialist reported Youth A disclosed Youth A was
watching channels on the television that were not approved by
staff. Youth A reported Staff 1 told her to change the channel.
Youth A admitted to getting upset with Staff 1 and threatened to
punch Staff 1.
Supervisor was interviewed at Vista Maria on 5/1/2025.
Supervisor was not present to witness the incident. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 has not been disciplined. Staff 1 is a good staff
who consistently abides by the rules and works to ensure youth
and staff abide by the rules. Supervisor reported no concerns with
how Staff 1 communicates. Supervisor reported per agency policy
it’s staff responsibility to ensure youth are watching appropriate
channels by redirecting as needed.
Unit Manager was interviewed at Vista Maria on 5/1/2025. Unit
Manager reported Staff 1 gets along with youth and other staff
fairly well. Staff 1 has no current discipline issues. Unit Manager
reported no other staff or youth reported a concern with Staff 1’s
conduct.
Video Reviewed:
Rose Hall Faith Unit video footage of 3/31/25 was reviewed on
4/11/2025. The video footage did not include audio. Staff 1 and
Youth A were seen in the common area. Staff 1 abruptly stood up
from her chair and positioned herself to block Youth A, who had
4

also stood and began walking toward Staff 1. Staff 1 removed her
glasses and stepped back into a defensive stance as Youth A
approached and attempted to punch her with a closed fist. Staff 1
blocked the initial punch by grabbing Youth A’s hand. Staff 2 was
then seen walking toward the altercation and pressing the clear
button before physically intervening. Youth A continued advancing
and threw another closed-fist punch, which Staff 1 again
attempted to block. Youth A grabbed Staff 1 before Staff 2
successfully intervened by stepping between them and separating
the two individuals. During this exchange, Staff 1 pulled Youth A’s
hair/bonnet once, although the bonnet did not come off. Staff 1 did
not immediately disengage and continued to verbally engage with
Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were present. Staff I appeared to be
arguing with Youth A evidenced by the way Staff 1 was pointing
her finger at Youth A. Staff 1 continued pointing and talking until
she grabbed her items and left the area. While Staff 1 moved to
grab her items, Youth A was observed walking towards Staff 1.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 remained between Youth A and Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 most recent
restraint training was completed on December 9, 2024.
There were no disciplinary actions found in the file.
• Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management
(Reviewed 4/10/2025):
This policy states personal intervention shall not be
used as a form of coercion, discipline, convenience, or
retaliation by staff.
• Policy POL-006-016 – Television Channel
Packages (Reviewed 4/10/2025): The policy outlines
staff are responsible for ensuring television channels
provided for client entertainment are appropriate and do
not include explicit language, sexual content, or violent
themes.
• Policy POL-022-114 – Employee Behavior:
This policy prohibits staff behavior such as fighting,
assaulting, threatening, or intimidating clients.
• Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client
Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and
appropriate conduct in all interactions with clients.
Employees must foster mutual trust and establish
positive working relationships. The policy explicitly
states that corporal punishment including spanking,
paddling, slapping, pinching, twisting arms, or pulling
hair is strictly prohibited under any circumstances.
5

Analysis The agency is found to be in non-compliance. During video
footage review Staff 1 was observed pulling Youth A’s hair/bonnet.
Staff 1 failed to adhere to the agency’s Client and Staff Interaction
Policy (002-406), which explicitly prohibits pulling a youth’s hair
under any circumstances. Additionally, Staff 1 missed an
opportunity to deescalate the situation by continuing to engage
with the youth even after other staff had intervene
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It was reported Youth A only meets with therapy twice a week for
30 minutes each per week. Youth reported group therapy does not
occur.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at Vista Maria on 5/14/2025. Youth A
reported she receives individual therapy weekly and was recently
assigned a new therapist. Youth A reported she receives group
therapy with the other youth in her building but it’s not consistent.
Youth A reported that she does not have family therapy. Youth A
reported her sister is listed as a support person she can call in
crisis, but her parents are not involved.
Foster Care Specialist was interviewed via telephone on
4/23/2025. Foster Care Specialist reported Youth A reported she
only meets with therapy twice a week for 30 minutes each per
week. Youth A reported group therapy does not occur.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 5/27/2025. Therapist
reported Youth A received weekly therapy. Therapist reported
youth in this program are offered at least one weekly session for
60 minutes and the frequency varies depending upon the needs of
the youth. It was further reported Youth A receives at least one
60-minute session per week or two 30-minute session a week
depending on the needs of Youth A.
Consumer Rights Advocate (CRA) was interviewed via face to
face on 6/9/25 at Vista Maria. CRA reported verifying Youth A
participation in group and family therapy with Clinical Supervisor.
6

It was reported Youth A does not have family therapy due to her
legal status as MCI ward. Group sessions are offered and held
daily with youth in this facility. However, there was no indication in
the system of Youth A’s participation. It was reported Youth A
declined most group therapy sessions offered. CRA reported
Youth A was offered and participated in Journey to Success (JTS)
activities which teaches life skills. It was reported these activities
are completed in a group setting and was Youth A’s preferred
activity over the traditional group therapy session.
Documents Reviewed:
• Vista Maria Mental Health Program Statement: Program
policy indicate services offered to youth are weekly
individual therapy, psychiatric/psychological
evaluations, monthly family and group therapy, sensory
integration approaches, expressive therapies, group
counseling focused on intervention, non-violent crisis
interventions approaches, community outings, daily
recreation, after-school activities, nursing services,
mentoring, life skills education, family visitation and phone
call opportunities, transportation to home visits when
appropriate, family engagement events, and aftercare
services for six months after discharge.
• Youth A therapy session confirmation- It documented Youth
A received Individual therapy on the following dates since
admission: 3/19, 3/20, 3/25, 3/27, 4/2, 4/7, 4/8, 4/10, 4/17,
4/21, 4/24, 5/2, 5/6, and 5/9.
• Youth A participates in Journey to Success ( JTS) activities
which are life skilled focused on a daily basis. The following
dates were verified for JTS: 3/25,3/26, 3/27, 3/29, 3/30,
3/31, 4/1, 4/4, 4/5-4/11, 4/13, 4/14, 4/16, 4/17, 4/20, 4/21,
4/25-4/30, 5/9, 5/17, 5/18, and 5/27.
Analysis The agency is found to be in compliance as interviews and
documentation shows Youth A participation in weekly individual
therapy and refused most group therapy sessions. Youth A does
not participate in family therapy as she is a MCI ward as parental
rights have been terminated.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and
Section prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
7

(a) Any type of physical punishment including but not limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A reported a staff redirected her by saying she should never
disrespect adults, and added if Youth A were her child, she would
"whoop her bottom." Youth A reported, "All staff say this,"
indicating that it was not one particular staff. Youth A reported
staff say this when upset with youth for not obeying the rules.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at Vista Maria on 5/14/2025. Youth A
reported a staff redirected her by saying she should never
disrespect adults, and added if Youth A were her child, she would
"whoop her bottom." Youth A denied Staff 1 made this comment to
her. Youth A went on to report, "All staff say this," indicating that it
was not one particular staff. Youth A reported staff say this when
upset with youth for not obeying the rules.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 5/27/2025. Therapist
reported Youth A did not disclose concern of staff whooping her
bottom to her.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 6/2/25. This staff denied
hearing threats made to Youth A or any other youth in the facility.
Staff 3 was uncertain where this allegation came from and
reported it being a lot of drama going on at Vista.
Unit Manager over Rose Hall was interviewed via telephone on
6/2/25. Unit Manager reported youth are able to make complaints
regarding their concerns with staff and over all well-being. Unit
Manager denied receiving complaints about her staff conduct
towards Youth A or any other youth in the facility.
Analysis The agency is found to be in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as Staff 3 and Unit Manager
denied the allegations. Youth A was also unable to identify a
specific time or staff member that made the threat to her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
